snippet: The Yankees’ sudden frugality is disorienting to fans, who were used to their win-at-any-cost mentality, and to opponents, who would like consistency from their tormentors.
abstract: George Vecsey Sports of The Times column opposes New York Yankees change in strategy after death of former owner George Steinbrenner; says new management is less involved with the team and unwilling to spend whatever it takes to get best players.
lead_paragraph: The Yankees’ sudden frugality is disorienting to fans, who were used to their win-at-any-cost mentality, and to opponents, who would like consistency from their tormentors.

headline.seo: Where Are the Yankees I Loved to Hate
headline.main: Where Are the Yankees I Loved to Hate?
headline.print_headline: Where Are the Yankees I Loved to Hate?
